# Draft:African Entertainment Awards USA (AEAUSA)

African Entertainment Awards USA (AEAUSA)
African Entertainment Awards USA (AEAUSA) is an annual awards ceremony based in Newark, New Jersey, celebrating notable achievements in African and Caribbean entertainment, culture, fashion, and socioeconomic industries. Launched in 2015, AEAUSA has grown to become one of the largest platforms recognizing African and Caribbean talents globally.
History & Background
Founded: 2015, as the premier African-centered entertainment awards in the USA.
Growth: Over its decade-long run, the program expanded its reach across multiple African, Caribbean, and Latin American nations. The Guardian described it as “the African continent’s largest entertainment award program.”
Notable Events: The 2024 edition featured a Fashion Show (Nov 8) and Awards Ceremony (Nov 9) at DoubleTree by Hilton, Newark Airport.
Format & Categories
The awards span over 40 categories, including but not limited to:
Best Male/Female Artist
Artist of the Year
Best Collaboration
Genre-specific awards (Hip Hop/Rap, Afro-fusion, Gospel, Reggae/Dancehall)
Regional distinctions (Central/West Africa, East/South/North Africa)
Special awards: Legends Award, International Artist, Digital Content Creator, etc.
Notable Winners & Recipients
2024 Highlights:
Artist of the Year: Davido
Best Male Artist: Wizkid
Best Female Artist: Ayra Starr
Legends Award: D’Banj
International Artist of the Year: Chris Brown
2023 Highlights:
Best Male Artist: Burna Boy
Artist of the Year: Harmonize
African Icon of the Year: Akon
2021 Notable Event:
The “Afro-Latino Artist of the Year” award sparked controversy when J Balvin received the honor, prompting the organizers to revise and rename the category to “Best Latin Artist of the Year.”
Impact & Reception
The J Balvin controversy garnered international attention, increasing AEAUSA’s visibility and prompting strategic category adjustments.
The event is frequently cited by global media and continues to attract top-tier artists across continents.
